title: Introduction to Science Studies Part II
description: Continuing the introduction developed in part I, this course examines recent key topics and problem situations in science studies. Emphasis is on recent theoretical perspectives and empirical studies in communication, history, philosophy, and sociology of science and technology, and the interplay between them. May be taken for credit up to six times. Students may receive a combined total of twenty-four units for ANTH 269, COGR 225D, HIGR 241, PHIL 209D, and SOCG 255D.
